stealth.details: @Check[Astronomy Lore|dc:41] (master) or @Check[nature|dc:45] (legendary) to notice signs of the approach of unusual celestial bodies

details.description: Impact from a sufficiently large asteroid would be powerful enough to wipe out a region or destroy a planet, but smaller-scale impact events, like from a meteor shower, present hazards that could be survived. This shower might arise naturally, or it might be the result of the PCs or other forces preventing a greater calamity by breaking a world-rending asteroid into smaller pieces.
details.disable: @Check[Astronomy Lore|dc:40] (master) or @Check[nature|dc:50] (legendary) to predict the trajectory of the falling asteroids and determine safe zones, @Check[athletics|dc:45] (legendary) or @Check[crafting|dc:47] (master) to dig underground shelters, @Check[diplomacy|dc:45] (master) or @Check[intimidation|dc:47] (master) to coordinate an orderly evacuation
details.routine: (1+ minutes, @Check[flat|dc:17]) Small asteroids rain down across the sky, battering and incinerating those caught in their path before carving craters. Over the course of a minute, enough asteroids smash into the ground and explode to inflict @Damage[6d10[bludgeoning],14d6[fire]|options:area-damage] damage to any unprepared characters in the area (@Check[reflex|dc:44|basic] save). The @Template[type:burst|distance:40]{40-foot-radius} craters left behind are greater difficult terrain.
